Aroma is salty, some wooden and mild lactic notes. Flavour is fruity, floral, lactic, salty and some wooden and toffeeish notes to it.

(650ml 2016 bottle from Systembolaget) Pours a cloudy medium gold with a huge white head that fades to a cap with massive lace. Aroma of lemon-limeade, citrus zest, bright salty notes, lots of herbal quality, some coriander, moderate funk. On the tongue, a lot of lemon-lime character, overlaying a bright salinity, a bit of herbal dried coriander in the finish, subtle funk on the back end too. Overall, pretty tart and a little mineral, with very low bitterness. Light body, low carbonation, refreshing. Not a fresh bottle so I think the hop fade has eliminated complexity vs. fresh, I remember more hops on tap @ CBC 16.
At Bodega Fermin in Barceloneta/Barcelona in a bottle. White head, clear light color. Mild, slightly salty, mildly sour, discrete sour aftertaste. Very correct Gose. Overall good beer.

Bottle from Shawan Liquors. Pours golden and clear with a white head. Leaves a shitload of lacing in the glass. Huge funk notes on the nose along with big coriander. Very tart and funky and salty on the tongue. Theres a huge amount of flavor here. Finished clean. Quite a lovely and refreshing beer.

Bottle in Seattle. Soft white foam, hazy yellow body. Lots of lemon-lime on the nose. Touch of hazy vinegar. Lots of grapefruit in sip, juicy and tart. Sourness blends in better over time. Touch of lacto creaminess at the finish. Tart and delicious.

On tap @ Rbabarrab. This ones has a cloudy looking paleish yellow golden colored body. A huge white quite good looking and lacing head on the top. Smells delicious. Little lemonadeny almost and peely. Lime peel for sure. Like a really good lemonade with apples and white wine. Really enjoying the aroma. It tastes more or less the same this. Lemonade like, citrussy and super refreshing. It has a thin oily texture in the mouth and its about average on the carbonation. Close up on the definition of refreshing, causes it really is. Whiteish slightly sour strawberries. Sorrel. A little old flower vase in the finish. Other than that, a superb one. 10.05.2017

Tap industry public house. Slight hazy straw color appearance. Neutral aroma. Taste is pleasantly mild and salty. Easily enjoyable.Fun. Quite mild on the palate. Yes, overall balanced yummy tart beer. Good stuff.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Wow does this gose ever smack you in the mouth with flavour. Nose of Brett, funk, hops, barrel. Sour lemon flavours, crisp tart and refreshing. Really good stuff.
Yellow, almost green lemonade cloudy body, white head and lacing. Tart vinegar, vinous, citrus, lactose aroma. Taste is sour, with a dry finish. A nice gose.

Flaska från SB. Tack Daniel! Ljust gyllengul, disig med medelhögt vitt skum. Fin frisk doft med citron, lime, lichie och lite lakto och brett. Inget extremt men väldigt snygg och välkomponerat, ganska torr men inte stram, fin fruktighet med citrus, krusbär och lichie, lätt sälta och en ganska snäll syra. Riktigt gott.

My Bottom Line:
This very citrusy and dry brew leaves a mineral trail on the palate, leading to plenty of acidity.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam tops the pale yellow.
-The flavour profile is a tad linear despite the complexity of the recipe.
-Acidity levels are high, but remain pleasant.
-Salt is well integrated.
-In the end, this doesnt taste like Gose much. But you can see the lineage once you read the label and have another sip.

Bottle.

Flaska från SB. Ljust gyllengul, disig med medelhögt vitt skum. Fin frisk doft med citron, lime, lichie och lite lakto och brett. Inget extremt men väldigt snygg och välkomponerat, ganske torr men inte stram, fin fruktighet med citrus, krusbär och lichie, lätt sälta och en ganska snäll syra. Riktigt gott.
Bottle from AJs Beer Warehouse. Lots of citra hops and a nice tart and salty taste.
(En fût à Bottlecraft NP): Très citronné, salin, suintant et épicé avec une bonne minéralité qui accentue la clarté des saveurs. Très réussi.

Keg at Ratebeer Best Beer Festival. 31/01/2016. A pale yellow golden coloured pour with a loose white head. Aroma is hard lemon, sharp lemon rind, salty. Flavour is composed of nice floral lemon, pollen, crisp light grains, tangy mineral finish. Palate is crisp grainy, little thin, moderate carboantion. Good stuff.

Man who doesnt love a good Gose? Aroma was decent. Sour wheat and a hint of funk. Pour was beautiful. Hazy very light gold with lots of rising bubbles and a thin white film for a head. So pretty it makes you want to go swimming in it. Taste was classic Gose. Light and sour with lemon and lemongrass taking center stage. Light and very heavy biting carbonation make this a perfect summer beer. Hope its still around in a few months!
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Hazy golden colour with white head. Citric aroma. Citric, salty, acidic taste. Medium body.
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Cloudy yellow body with a small white head. Citrus, lemon, zesty, fruity, tart, light salty.

Flaska. Klar guldfärgad med ett vitt långvarigt skum. Dofter av citron, örter och instängt sovrum. Smakinslag av citron, omogna krusbär, saltvatten och gräs. Syrlig avslutning, men en lättare salt-ton i eftersmaken.

Wazig licht blond bier met weinig wit schuim. Geur: vlierbloesem en honing. Smaak: zuur, citroen, sodawater, zout, wat metaal. Lichte koolzuurprikkel. Lichte tot medium body. Afdronk: licht zuur, vlierbloesem. Aangename dorstlesser.

Poured a hazy dark golden color with a white head. Aroma was of big sweaty sock funk salinty, pineapple and cat piss, yes please! Flavor similar, big juicy mosaic like hip punch, medium tartness, mild salt and finishes with a lovely funk. So good.
Ljusgul molnig. Mycket skum som lägger sig till ca en cm. Luktar tropiskt, citrus. Härligt sur och salt. Och citron. Gillas.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Appearance is pale, golden with medium white head. Aroma is fruity hops with hay and citrus. Taste is fruity, sour and slightly salty. Really refreshing beer!

Good citrus and fruity. The taste is similar and sweeter. Very easy to drink. Really good bitterness that fills the upper and front part of the mouth for a long time. Tasty and sweet beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Aroma is tart and a light fruity lemon character. Light yeasty and somewhat hoppy smell as well. Taste is really refreshing, with a light sour and funky kick. Tart citrus and light barnyard. Excellent

Bottled from Systembolaget
Hazy yellow with a white head. 
Tartish citrus in the aroma; lime, orange, lychee. 
Tart flavour with more citrus and some spiciness.
Gulbrun klar med to fingre høyt hvitt skum. Lukter blomster, gress, hvete og sitrus. Smaken er sur, grapefrukt, syrlige epler, floralsk. Middels lang tørr avslutning.
Beslöjad gul öl med ett småbubbligt vitt skum. Doft av citrussyrlighet, hö och lättare jästtoner. I smaken märks humlen mer och en lätt funkighet anas.

On tap at Stone yard - East with Patty, Dan and Erica. Erica likes the sours. I bought this for her, but then she says she does not feel well. I finish most of it for her. Very tart like a sweet tart!. Lighter than the other sour I had that day.

Bottle 65cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Hazy golden.
T: Tart, citrus, fruity.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2016 Pours light yellow with a small live of white head. Aroma; lemongrass, floral, yeast, some funk, green apples, kiwi and coriander. Taste; Lemongrass, yeast, green apples, yeast, coriander and sour.
A: Light yellow coloured with a thin white head N: Citrus, coriander seed, papaya T: Citrus, lime, blood orange, papaya O: Very well balanced! Impressive!

650ml bottle. Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is lime, orange, ripe grapefruit, light tropical fruitiness and light lacto. Taste is acidic with lime, grapefruit, general citrusiness, light tropical fruits, herbal spices, cilantro, light mineral tones and lacto. Medium mouthfeel, light carbonation and dry acidic aftertaste.

Bomber from web SB cons 2016-12-03 Göteborg 
AR: acid citric, ripe grapefruit, 
AP: wee hazy golden, fizzy chemical white small foam
F: acid citric, tart grapefruit, lemon flesh, concentrate lemon juice... to much!

Klar, mycket ljust gul, vitt skum. Doft: Funk, jord, jordkällare, brett, humle, omogen persika och passionsfrukt, godis, lite parfym. Stark 7:a. Smak: Citron, lite brett, funk, omogena bär, citron yoghurt, omogen persika, malt och humle i eftersmaken. Stark 7:a.

Pours hazy golden with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of gooseberry, kiwi, lime, funk, green apples, minerals. Taste is very fruity and quite sour with earthy and mineral notes. Mouthfeel is very dry and crisp with medium carbonation. Excellent!!

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Hazy golden, mid sized head. Milky tartness meets mango up front. Tart with citric/lactic acidity and light body. Lemon juice with mango and guava. Mid bitter finish. With buzzwords such as "Brettanomyces" and "massive dose of" on the commercial description, you know youre in for something as nuanced as a Big Mac with double extra ketchup. Still functional if you are looking for a tart fruit juice with good bitterness.

Pale yellow color, medium white head. Tart aromas of elderberry, wheat, citrus and slight hop. Very tart taste of elderberries that quickly diminishes and leave room for some sweet flavors of berries, lemon, fruits and grass. Really interesting and surprisingly balanced.

Mycket frisk doft av citrus, passionsfrukt och fläder. Smaken är kraftigt syrlig med tydlig citrus, passionsfrukt och salt. Härliga bubblor, likt champagne. En mycket trevlig Gose, med en rejäl laddning humle!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: NOV 18, 2016 Flaska systembolaget. Disig blekgul vätska. Bonnig doft. Halm, krusbär och citron. Syrlig smak. Krusbär, citrus, salt, halm, örter och mjölksyra. Torr eftersmak

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear, pale yellow with nice, thick, white head. Bretty, dusty aroma with wood, bread, orange and a bit of peach. Fruity, orange taste with a bit of tartness and some minerality and floral notes. Elegant and very tasty.

4 finger white head, yellow golden body. Nose: Peach, withe bread, oranges and lemon. Taste: Peach, lemon, wheat, white bread, yogurt and vinegar-notes. Semi-long tart ending with some/little bitterness.

How: Bottle.
Where: SBWF 2016.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Fruit, yeast, hops, citrus, caramel, some tart.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Sour, fruit, some tart, caramel, citrus.
Nice wheat and lemon citrus aroma, clear golden color with thing bubbly white head. Sweet hibiscus tart beauty. Light and dry crispy aftertaste.

November 12, 2016. Bottle at home. 
Hazy yellow with a medium sized white head leaving a nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is fruity, funky and hoppy with lemon, orange, green apple, gooseberries, sweet tropical fruits, brett, minerals, some floral notes. Taste is tart, fruity and light salty. Medium bodied, smooth small bubble carbonation. Finish is slightly dry and tart with lemon, gooseberries, green apple, minerals, some funk. 
Great, very refreshing.
Flaska från SB. Disigt ljusgul med vitt skum. Syrlig, funkig doft. Lätt och torr. Lite brett, lite humle, lite salt, mycket udda.

651ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy straw golden, medium size, white head, some lacing. Citric aromas, lime, lemon, cheese, yeast and yogurt. Light-bodied, medium carbonated. Lemon sour and salty taste, citrus, yellow kiwi, grapefruit, minerals, yeast and lactose. Refreshing!

Ljusgul, disig med ett tätt, gräddigt, vitt skum som fäster på glaskanterna. Syrlig doft med mycket citrus, lite ananas, gräs, halm och aningen stalltoner. Rejält syrlig smak med massor av citron plus lite sötare ananas, avslutningen är sträv och aningen kryddig. En riktigt fräsch och lite tuff gosevariant.

Dorado pálido y lechoso con espuma blanca ligera. Aromas de mineral, brett, manzana verde, balsamicos y cítricos. en boca es ligera y fresca con sabor mineral, salado, acidez refrescante, ciruela verde y cítricos con un final seco largo.

Poured from bottle. Aroma of white wine and malt. Light gold with a bit of head. Definitely sour with fruit, malt, wine. Old drinkability for a sour. My least favorite style, but this one is pretty good.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Draught @ CBC 2016 [ Red Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, Oksnehallen Vesterbro, Halmtorvet 11, 1700 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Stillwater Gose Gone Wild ].Clear medium yellow color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, fruity malt, moderate yeasty, citrus - grass. herbs, parsley. Flavor is moderate sweet, light acidic and bitter with a long duration, grass, herbs, sweet malt, citrus. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160514]

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2016 22oz bottle from Total Wine (Alexandria, VA). Aromas are herbal, grassy, lemon peel, farty deli ham, floral. Hazy orange-straw with a fairly lasting white head. Dry, tart, floral, lemony. Light bodied, crisp.

A golden gose with a thin white head. In aroma, nice ground cherries with light acidity, sour, light salt, very nice. In mouth, a refreshing tart mix of ground cherries, lactic acid, Epsom salts, light Brett, very nice. Bottle at Cask Days 2016.

Sample at SBWF 2016. 

Yellow with a white head. Tart with citrus, some yeast, funk and some grass. Refreshing and easy to drink. A decent one.

22oz bottle. Pours pale yellow with a moderate frothy white head. Aroma sour, salty, full of grapefruit, and has a strong Brett yeast presence. Taste is sour lemon, yeast funk, some grapefruit/citrus, and salt. Some wheat. Dry finish. Light body. Light carbonation. Crisp mouthfeel.

Draught at Fermentoren. High lasting white creamy head. Hazy light yellow green body. Exotic fruity aroma with a bit of lemon. Relatively acidic to sour lemon grapefruit flavor with hints of pepper. Low carbonation. Long finish.

(Bottle) Cloudy, pale yellow body with a big, quickly dissipating white head. Aroma of meyer lemon and grapefruit, floral notes, and wheat. Thin, soft body; light carbonation. Flavor is sour lemon, which almost masks the German wheat character but not entirely; some black pepper. Straight forward and clean.

Super hazy golden coloured body with a honey glow and a very nice three centimetre tall pure white head. Aroma of sour grain, a bit of funk, a light malt aroma, good fruit and more of the soured/brett yeast element. Light-bodied; Strong sour and funky flavour at first with some citrus and light malt evident, along with some wheatie and dry herbal flavours and a bit of sweetness from fruit at the finish. Aftertaste is very funky, sour, slightly salty with a bit of kick from the light malt, but very easy to drink and almost perfectly sour. Overall, a very nice gose that was nice to sample on draught, especially after having the Phuket version of this in bottles in New York. I sampled this sixteen ounce pint on draught at the end of my driveway at Whole Foods in Pentagon City (Arlington), Virginia on 27-September-2016 for US$6,00.
Tap at CBC 16, red session. Hoppy. Aroma of citrus, pineapple and pine with some wheat notes. Friuty and funky. Mainly zesty sour taste. A good one.
On tap at CBC 2016, red session. Pours hazy yellow, white head. Citrus, lemon, hoppy, yeast, fruit, funky, salt. Juicy. Sour and light bodied.

Sampled on draft at 3R6P this beer poured a cloudy dark yellow with a small foamy white head that left great lacing. The aroma was sourish lemon and salt. The flavor was tart lemon, lactic, tangy. Yeast and had notes or orange and salt. Long finish. Medium body. Well done.

Draft at Brazil. Pours a pale yellow with a small sudsy white head. Aromas of sour funk, citrus, straw, and grass. Flavor was super tart with lemon, dill, straw, grass. Light body and texture, bubbly carbonation, a crisp tart finish. Refreshing.
An aroma of citrus, honey and hops. Pours a a hazy lemon color. A refreshing lemon and citrus taste. A light body with a tart citrus finish.

Poured from a bottle. Hazy light yellow color, small white head. Nice hops aroma. Medium body with a nice lemony tart flavor with a nice bread flavor and a medium finish. Nice drinkability. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap at CBC 2016. Yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, spice, salt, sourness and citrus.

This was poured into a stange.
The appearance was a hazy golden yellow color with a quickly dissipating foamy/bubbly head. No lacing.
The aroma starts off with some sweet pulpy to tart lemon flavor. Delicate sour-ed wheat base shows its face slightly into some lime. Salinity level seems good.
The flavor takes the previously mentioned flavors to combine nicely - sour to tart, slight sweet pulpy underneath. Lime/resin backbone slides into the aftertaste and on into the finish in a sour/tart sort of way.
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a sly sessionable sour/salty trait to it. Balancing puckering refreshing sort of hit on my tongue. Carbonation feels good for what it is.
Overall, really nice gose that I would have again
On tap at Mikkeller bar SF. Pours a cloudy pale yellow. White head. Aromas of sweat, lemon juice, old socks. Yum. Taste is sour and salty. Freaking amazing gose.

Draught at Mikkeller SF. Hazy yellow color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, salt, earthy notes, ripe fruits, yeast, wheat and a bit of hops. Sour finish with citrus, earthy notes, tart, salt, ripe fruits and grass. Excellent gose.

Rating #6969 *snicker*. Light hazy gold with a Rocky white cap that leaves nice lace. Lovely aroma thats lemony and funky, a touch briney. Big poppy flavor thats dry and refreshing, but also zesty and bright and funky. Big lemon zest tartness and big funk, a little citrus dry hop, Brett yeast, and a little briney tartness. Dry twang on the end.

650 ml bottle from trade with bytemesis. Thank you Mike!! Hazy yellow color with white head. Yeasty and hoppy aroma, spicy, herbal, basil citrus, pineapple, pine, funky, bretty. Sweet, bitter and light acidic taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

From notes. Had this one at Dougs house for a celebration of his birthday on May 14. 22 oz bottle. The pour is a great straw yellow color with a light cloudiness and a great white head. There is a ton of salt and tart citrus on the nose. Light grassy hop and just a lovely tartness to it. Its a little grassy, but good. The flavor is even better. Tart, salty, crisp and juicy. There is a nice tropical fruit to go with the tartness. The mouth feel is crisp and clean with a nice lingering tartness and a pretty hefty salt. I love this for a gose, thats for sure.

Draught @ CBC 2016. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, littel brett, light sourness, citrusly hops. Flavor is light sour, wheat, yeast, brett, light salty, citrus. Thin to medium body, lively carbonation. 140516
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow color. Aroma and taste are funk, lemon, citrus, and wheat. Wow.
Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of lemon, tropical fruit, pine, salt and wheat. Taste is moderately sour, lightly bitter and lightly salty.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 From a bottle. Pours opaque gold with a fizzy white head. Tastes like lemon, lime, pear, salty cracker malt, dry wheat, straw, and grassy hops. Light/medium body and medium carbonation. Smells like lemon, lime, pear, salty cracker malt, dry wheat, straw, and grassy hops. Thanks jheath99!

Bottle shared by jheath99. Pours slightly hazy straw gold. Aroma is citrus, lactic funk, wheat and pislner malts, grapefruit, and faint salt. Flavor is light, crisp, salty, tart, and a delicious burst of citrusy hoppy goodness. Light body.

Light fruity and malty with some bretty and grassy hoppy notes, citric lemon zing, light body and carbonation, light peppery notes, pinch of salt, dry fruity finish.
Very good. Pale straw yellow pour with short lived fizzy head. No lacing. Aroma is hoppy citrus. Taste is funky and tart. Enjoyable.

Tropical fruity hops with some funk and a tart finish. Taste is mild salty with a nice sourness, maybe 5 of 10 sour and mostly lactic. There is some earthy funk, but 80/20 lactic to funk. More of a dry bitter finish than the Westbrook, hops are deforest noticeable in the finish ( and throughout). This is quite good, a nice base gose with solid amount of hops, but I think I like Westbrook slightly more. Lemon citrus is a prominent flavor too. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Stillwater knows how to make a style irresistible to me. Add hops. It worked for American Lager with Yacht, and now theyve done it with Gose in Gose Gone Wild. This beer looks standard enough. Yellow, cloudy, heady. The nose is beautifully hoppy with bright citrus. The flavor is a revelation. Its a blend of yeasty fruity/tartness and hoppy fruity/juiciness. Lemon, orange, and passion fruit. The feel is luscious and crisp. Its hard to imagine beer getting more refreshing than this. Im sold.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2016 Bottle.

A- Lemon, dank, citrus, soap.

A- Yellow color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Slightly sour, lemonade.

P- Light body, average texture, medium carbonation, refreshing finish.

O- A bit dank on the nose and almost like a hoppy wheat. Not very salty as Id expect but a very refreshing lemonade flavor on the palate. Really unique, not traditional, but good. Although not sure Id consider this a Top 3 in the style.
CBC. Slightly hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, lemon, yeast, wheat and hops. Flavour is malt, lemon, salt, hops, lemon peel, little sour, little sweet and a little bitter.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Red session, København
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, tart and fruitness. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with a long dry, citrus, tart, salty and light fruity finish. Body is light, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
Hazy straw color, thin wispy head. Spicy aroma, dank, banana, clove. Creamy yet peppery on the tongue. Tart green apple, taffy, a little phenol. Love the lingering finish.

Bomber from Whole Foods PM. Pours turbid golden with frothy, white head. Nose is that juicy, delicious Maine/Vermont hop nose that you all crave so much. The taste is tart, lemony, hoppy. Gets more tart as it warms, with huge lemony and grapefruity notes, florals, juicy hops, and some salinity. This one is truly mouth puckering, and truly delicious!
Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter very sour and hoppy flavor. Long great complex finish. Oily palate. Nice.

Bottle from the market -shared with Cary waiting for ovens. Delicious, complex, subtle and funk. Its basically a more interesting version of Westbrook Gose- which is already a favorite. They somehow tamed it and made it more intriguing at the same time. Has all the good gose notes- citrus, tart, salty, grass, wheat- the lists goes on. Its really good and I want some more.

CBC. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, wheaty, citrus and light tart. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet, moderate bitter and salty finish with a light acidic edge. 140516

CBC16, red session, tap. Clear pale yellow with an off-white head. Aroma ligh malty, medium sour and hoppy, citrusy, floral. Flavor medium+ sour and refreshing bitter, citrusy, ending dry. Light body.

Keg at Sedona Charlottesville, 2/24/16. Hazy yellow, thin creamy white head, good retention. Aroma of brett, cactus, citrus. The taste is tart lemon, brett, cactus, wheat. Medium bodied, bright, lingering tartness.
Hazy yellow pour, larger head. Aroma of citrus, wheat, light funk. Taste has lemon and citrus up front, mild tartness, wheat, light salt. Lighter body and extremely drinkable.

Bottle. Pours a hazy pale yellow with an off-white head. Aroma of lemon, citrus, funk and had a hint of salt. Flavor was tart and dry with lemon rind, funk, wheat, citrus, tart fruit and a pinch of salt

14-MAY-2016, draft @CBC Red Session with Ulkløbben:-)
Very pale with a low whte head.
Fruit, citrus, wheat, tart, thin. Very refreshing and nice.
Bottle. Lactic lemon, salt, and wheat malt aroma. Cloudy pale yellow with moderate head. Sweet-tart lemon, wheat malt, salt, and lightly bitter hay flavor. Nice body.

Bottle. Light hazy light amber liquid with medium white head. Aroma of lemon, red apples, grain, mineral and light earthy funk. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of lemon, apple and grapefruit. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Awesome.

Une superbe bière à la robe claire et à la fine mousse. Le nez est superbe tout en fruits acidulés sur un fond de brett et dagrumes. La bouche est fraîche, délicate, fruitée, délicieusement acidulée et la finale et longue et persistante. Un régal de fin de soirée.
Sample @ CBC16, Copenhagen. Red session. Cloudy light golden pour with a small head. Long time want! Lots of juicy hops, orange peel, stone fruits, lime and some light straw.

Where and how:  Bottle 650? ml at Volo 
Aroma: hinted with pear, apples mild vanilla. Very approachable nose.
 Appearance : 
Top: small cap, white.
Base: hazy, golden ale
Palate :  medium thinner body, frisky.
Taste: tart refreshing qualities, tart sour fruit. Neatly setup.
 other notes  quiet refreshing choice.

Pours a slightly hazy yellow from a bottle. Lemon aroma with a bit of slightly moldy hay. Flavor is a brisk tart lemon, salt, and a good dose of brett funk. It took me by surprise, but definitely grew on me. Good beer.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2016 Sample at CBC 2016. Tart and fruity smell. Similar taste. Refreshing. Light body. Summer beer. Re-rated at a Systembolaget tasting and upped the score from 3,7 to 4. The tart dominates over the hops.

Pours a hazy yellow with a white foam head. Aroma is floral and citrus/grapefruit and salt and mineral. Flavor is lots of floral notes, some citrus, mineral, and salt. Has a light body and a tart, dry finish. Theres an interesting aroma and flavor here, and I wonder if the water is contributing to this. Nice.
On tap at CBC 2016 - day 2. Feint bretty aromas, citrus , lemonade, a bit of vanilla and some interesting hops.

I was saving this for a sunny summer day and the weather finally delivered so I hit the beach to imbibe.

A light gold with an aroma of fresh zester lemon and spicy wheat. The taste is earthy tart lemon, wheat spicy notes and salt.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 22oz bottle, undated but assumedly fresh, from Fort Point Market, drunk 1/5/16. Brewed and bottled at Crazy Mountain BrewingWonderful appearance, a rich, waxen, golden-yellow body with glowing haziness and a large white head that fades slowly to cover.Oh shit. Oh my, that is certainly unexpectedly incredible. Sublime balance of floral, spice, brett, and delicate, gentle tropical fruit and citric hops. Not explosive, not quite, but what it lacks in sheer power it more than makes up for in just pure, undeniable pleasure. Just an inherently "good" aroma and more or less perfect. Sniffed the stuff for many, many minutes before taking a sip and really could have kept on for much longer. Nothing dominates and theres no trace of metal, dirt, blandness, alcohol, heavy citrus or any other potential problem Ive seen in various goses.The flavor almost lives up to the aroma; not quite, as at times theres just a touch of yeasty blandness that somewhat dulls the brightness. Its pretty minimal, though, and youre still left with meyer lemon, clover honey, soft, fuzzy, warm brett tones, perfectly tight carbonation and attenuation and a substantial yet dry feel to it. Acidity is never punchy or forced and builds up slowly and gently, complementing the other notes. Hops are near-perfect here, adding very little bitterness, no resin or cattiness and coming across more like nelson sauvin (which is a compliment in my book). Though amarillo and citra, when done perfectly are both incredible hops, and I daresay amarillo in peak condition might rival nelson sauvin. Anyways, this beer blew me away and I hope I can find more of it (was the last bottle on the shelf).

Served in a Teku from bomber. Served 6mo old. Oddly, prefer this 6mo old than fresh. 

Aroma  compelling scents of sea salt and acidity emanate from the surface of this brew. I have not encountered a Gose with aromatic qualities of this nature.

Appearance  opaque golden hue glistens and gleams. Moderate frothy, white head-retention dissipates over time, but remains for minutes after pouring into Teku. Sediment congregates at bottom of glass and appears goopy white from outside of glass, but is truly a brownish-white goop when peering in from above glass. As you pour the remaining bottle into the glass, the beer is murky, pastel-like yellowish-white.

Taste  fascinating, marvelous concoction of sour, funky, salty sensations. Subtle vestiges of Westbrooks Gose coalesce brilliantly with Stillwaters ingenuity. Skeptical one could notice the alcohol in this brew prior to reading the label.

Palate  For style, there is nothing this Gose does not accomplish. Goes Gone Wild delicately explores each and every avenue of the palate and exhibits its magnificence throughout each and every sip.

Overall  This beer is in a class of its own; a truly transfixing showstopper of a Gose. Typically, I do not compare styles... Sorry, but this is one of my favorite beers of all time. Drinkability wise and quality wise, I cannot put many brews of any style past this one. Take the time to smell the roses.

Flavor smacks you with lemony tartness right off the bat, vitamin C tablets, really tart/fresh yogurt, grassy, straw, some muddled citrus - meyer lemon and white grapefruit. The brett is a little lost. This would be an interesting beer to age a bit. Youd lose the dank hops on the nose, but you could get some extra funk in the flavor. Either way, very cool.

Large, white head, staunch with a thin lace. Murky, milky white color. Nose is juicy with lemon lime, yeasty bready notes, tart with some notes of burnt wiring as it warms, dare i say,,, danky?? Body is light, carbonation is wonderful, spritzy and the tang is ginormous! A real palate awakening! Dry, lightly bready malts, brash citrus flavors and of course that dry saline enhanced profile.Think the hops have faded somewhat but still good juice! Dry, highly acidic finish is big and tart and the salt on the lips makes this one savory brew. Lemon lime notes are juicy and just really enhanced with the salty notes. Really nice stuff. Potent! Bomber from statelineliquors.Bottled version seems a bit moreish than the draft version i have had.

Bottle @ Gregs palace. Thanks Luke! Pours a bit hazy golden appearance with a big white head. Big citrus, grapefruit, guava, tropical fruity nose with some light funk and sea water. Pretty fucken tart. Some salt and funk along with a ton of grapefruit and guava. Tart, refreshing, and quite hoppy. Kind of a fun beer.
Salty sour and citrusy. Pours cloudy golden with great head and lacing. Finishes tart with some sour plum and lots of salt. Great beer, some zest in here as well. Tap at Of Love and Regret.
Sample at a bottle share. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, funk, and spice. Taste is citrus, tropical, funk, spice, and salt. Very nice.
Draft. Pour is hazy yellow. Brett, citrus on the nose. Slight salt taste with a hoppy citrus and brett finish. Very nice beer. Interesting combination of funk, citrus and light malt.

Bomber. Uh, pardon me Sir, may I have another? And another after that? Just keep pouring this down my throat with allowing me at least 5 minutes to take each sip properly, thoroughly and fully. Thank you. This is one incredible funked up Bretted straw and salty filled amazing piece of beer. YES.

Bottle. Pours hazy butterscotch with a large off-white head, puffy and creamy, slow to dissipate, great lacing. Aroma is, oh yeah, Brett!, lots of citrus, lemon, grapefruit. Medium tart. Flavor is dry, a bit funky, salty, a citrus bomb for sure. Light body, Absolutely yummy. This is god nectar. Moar.

Poured from bottle to glass. Hazy straw hue with fizzy white head that lingered. Aroma is huge lemon, straw, peppercorn, ripe key limes. Mouthfeel is fantastic with a medium light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry throughout with a nice salty bitter finish. Overall this was a very enjoyable brew.
Cloudy straw pour. Big white head. Plenty of lacing. Hoppy sour aroma. Huge tartness. Pepper. Lemon.

Bottle thanks to max. Pours a beautiful hazy milky orange body with thin white lacing. Aroma is incredibly delicate salty tartness, lime, dank Nelson and light passion fruit. Mouthfeel is perfectly tart with notes of sour fruit - lemon, passion fruit, lime, salt, peach, lemonade and funky. Awesome.

pours slightly hazy yellow. Smell is sour lemon and hops. Interesting. like a funky gumballhead. Pretty tart, and fairly hoppy. Not quite as sour as WEstbrook Gose, but close, and a nice dose of hops with some light sweetness in the aftertaste. Pretty interesting and enjoyable.
Bottle at Churchkey. Cloudy yellow color, white head. Aroma of funky lemons left in attic corners to collect dust and black pepper. Taste is softly sour peach, lemon, summer fruit. Holy cow!

On tap at Apex. 

A: Clear golden straw w/ a fluffy white head.

N: Lemon, lavender, crackers, salt mines, watermelon and cantaloupe. Oranges and grapefruit rind. 

T: Salty and most pleasantly sour. 

M: Light and drinkable. Sharp carbonation. 

O: People have told me how good this is, and I am very glad I listened to their recommendation. This is the best Gose I have had, hands down.
Incredible gose sour hopped up treat. Cloudy yellow with lace sheet. On tap at wirld of beer charlotte.rich citrus orange premier white wine aroma.

Draft at Belmont Station, Portland. Pours a slightly hazy light straw, very effevescent. Nose lively and funky, aged cheddar. Body very lively, arch and dry with a slight sour kick. This is some good stuff.

Bottle at PIB, pours a cloud orangey blonde with a small white head. Nose brings out a nice mix of funk and salt, with a dry hoppiness to it. Flavour is very funky and moderately salty, with horse blanket and salt that dominate. Very complex and drinkable. One of the most elegant goses Ive had. Excellent job here.

Growler thanks to Russell. Pours a cloudy yellow orange with medium frothy off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong citrus, brett, tart fruit, funk. Thin mouthfeel with a nice tart citrus, funk, light salt, easy to drink, very good.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2014 Bottle. Rating 8,100. Pours orange gold white head. Nose/taste of tart lemon, sea salt, sour wheat, sour banana, spritzy lemon juice, bretty citrus and grapefruit and funk. Lighter medium body.

Bottle @ home. Thanks, Jake. Hazed golden pour with a white head. Fruity, tropical, acidic aroma. Lots of pineapple and guava. Sticky honey and vanilla. Good lemon and green apple, a bit of straw as well. Flavor has a nice acidity to it. Lots of lemon, tropical fruit, and grass. Some green apple and sweet honey. Huge mango and passion fruit. Slight guava preserves. Good stuff.

Keg @ Hair of the Dog. Slightly hazy gold with a small head. Nose is pineapple, pear, peach. Rotting fruit funk. Taste is of salted Capri sun, and I mean that in the best way possible. Nice and bright, flavorful.
carried over from untapped to try and organize my beers for syncronicitys sake.

gose bright yellow pour with fluffly white head. Aroma peach mango fruity hops. Some funk. Tastes big lemons. Moderate brine some wheaty character. apple cider vinegar. sharp acidity slight syrup smoothness

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, no bottle dating. Pours moderately hazy golden orange color with a 2 finger dense and rocky white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big tart lemon peel, lime, green apple, grapefruit, orange zest, pineapple, mango, white vinegar, brine, herbal, hay, straw, grass, musty funk, white bread, and yeast earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/funky yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and brine/pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart lemon peel, lime, green apple, grapefruit, orange zest, pineapple, mango, white vinegar, brine, herbal, hay, straw, grass, musty funk, white bread, and yeast earthiness. Good amount of fruity acidic tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon peel, lime, green apple, grapefruit, orange zest, pineapple, mango, white vinegar, brine, herbal, hay, straw, grass, musty funk, white bread, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity and robustness of fruity/funky yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and brine/pale malt sweetness; with an awesome malt/acidity balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with very smooth, crisp, and moderately briny/acidic mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with no warming present after the finish as expected of 4.3%. Overall this is an absolutely incredible hoppy gose style! All around fantastic complexity and robustness of fruity/funky yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and brine/pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink with the balanced acidity. An extremely delicious offering.

Draft wob. Aroma is lemon pledge, brett, and orange peel. Cloudy gold color. Sips tart and citrusy. The salt really gives it a boost and crisp umamines in the finish. Body is medium and crisp with a nice sour bite. Very refreshing and lemony. Not sure how many I c pulse drink, but this one is hitting the spot.

[ Bottle ][ 22oz ][ Tasting ][ Tasting ][ Globe ][ 7.26.14 ]
>> Cloudy white peach pour with dwindling foam. Nose is powerful yuzu fruit, amazing citrus, similar to Westbrook Gozu. Taste is mouth puckering mega lime, holy monkey, yuzu fruit power. Nom nom, feels a bit too sour, but very similar to the Gozu though perhaps more sour. Still, refreshing and super bright, super citric.

Hazy straw yellow color with a big bright white head that lasts forever and leaves good lacing. Aroma is tart with lemon and citrus as well as some cracker malt. Taste is similar with a big tartness that is tempered somewhat by the cracker malt flavor. Lemon drops and citrus along with a minerality. Finishes crisp with some tartness. Mouthfeel is crisp with a light/medium body and high carbonation. Really nice tartness that is balanced but not overtaken the other flavors.

Bottle: Thanks, Mike. Slightly muddled, bright yellow body. A soapy white film leaves moderate spots of wet lacing behind. Aroma has a solid mixture of lightly acetic lemon, sour lacto, & sweaty jockstrap funk. Elements of salt, coriander, & milled grains can be found buried underneath, but this is a sour ale first and foremost (on the nose, anyway). Nice lemon juice tartness from the first sip, puckering. Quite sour! Mild brine-like notes with sour lacto, grains, some funky hay, leading to a finish thats quite acidic & super dry. Funky & sweaty funk (thanks to the Brett) grows with time. Like a Lemon-Head flavored sweatsock.... with a hint of salt. Perhaps its just me, but I dont get much from the addition of Citra or Amarillo... the Brett & lacto seem to just devour the tastebuds. A very tasty "sour ale", but honestly I think I prefer Westbrooks regular gose.

Bottle from Covenhoven. Matte applesauce color with a finger of frothy white Head. Some webbing. Beautiful. Aroma of lavender, sawdust, wheat and fresh cherries. Medium body. Lots of fresh squeezed grapefruit, light brine, Brett and earthy good. Lip snacking good.

Tap at Maxs. Pours lightly hazy yellow with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is lemon, salt, light Pils malt, earthy wheat and lactic, barnyard sourness. Aroma is dank hops, lactic grapes and lemon, earthy and spicy wheat malt, cracker notes, salt and a dry finish. Light body and lively carbonation.

On draught... a buncha times.
Pours a hazy bright yellow with a good head and some nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is super bright with nice fruit notes of lemon, lime, & some peaches. Its got a light leathery funkiness to it and a touch of brine. 

The flavor is very tart, its got some raw rhubarb character, some lemon, and a whole bunch of peach. The saltiness is mild but noticeable, the hops are very bright and fruity, & the beer is dry with a pretty high level of sourness. 

I just really like it a lot.

22 oz. bottle from Conn. Ave Wine & Liquors. Hazy gold pour, fluffy white head. Nose and flavor are ridiculous, with huge sour lemon, unripe apricot & peach, pithy bitter orange and grapefruit, lip-smacking salinity, and aggressive acidic funk. Really more of a sour than a true gose by traditional standards, but sweet Jesus is it quenching and delicious.

At APEX with Stephen. Pours hazy neon orange no head. Aroma is sour tart, light citrus, melon, hint of slalt. Taste is sweet tart, salty, funky, tangy light fruits, fresh drinkable. Fantastic funky gose.

On tap at Apex. Pour is hazy golden with a frothy white head and great lacing. Big sour lemon lime, biscuit, lightly salty, urine, lacto, straw, and funk on the aroma. Big sour lemons, lactic, margarita salt, light graininess, horse blanket, hay and stone fruits with a big sour finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Really awesome gose with high sourness yet highly crushable.

Draft. Pours a hazy straw yellow color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have strong tart/sour citrus, grapefruit, orange peel, salt, acidic, puckering at times, but surprisingly very drinkable. This was not something I was looking for, but turned out to be very good.

Pours a pale almost banana yellow. Very cloudy. Medium white head. All fine foam. Little lacing but it could be the glass. Aroma is odd. I think its a mix of hops, lacto and spice, but its hard to separate things out. I like it, but the initial smell was a bit of a shock. Kinda pickley. Strong yogurt sour note with tropical fruit and citrus. Taste is quite lacto sour. Big tropical hop flavor. Some butyric acid, a tad off putting. Lots of pucker. A bit of yogurty body and otherwise light. Very interesting but I cant say that I love it.

22. Boom! This stuff is fucking amazing. Pours a cloudy medium gold with a loose sudsy white head that sticks around for a while as film. Big tangy orange peel nose, even when cold. Salty and citric and pleasant. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Orange peel, orange pith, juicy, tangy, oily, puckery. Super intense and forward but in a very balanced way with body and carbonation that balance it perfectly. Long puckery finish. Awesome beer.

Bottle. Cloudy gold with a foamy white head. Strong sour fruit, funky yeast, wheat, grains, salt and spice with yogurt notes. Taste is big sour fruit, yogurt, toasted wheat, grains, salt, funky yeast, floral and earthy hops and zesty citrus. Body is light with a strong bubbly carbonation and a lingering acidic tartness. Ends with more yogurt, sour fruit, funky yeast, floral hops, citrus, lots of wheat, grains and earthy funk.

Draught. Pours a rather hazy orange tan color with a moderate white head on it. Nose is sour with a bit of funk to it and reminds me of a saison a bit. Taste is sour and has a bit of a bite to it, with citrus and some subtle salty notes coming through. Interesting.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016 Draft pour. Pours a beautiful hazy dark yellow. Super sour fruit aroma. Perfect tart fruit flavor. Some orange and maybe a little peach. Nice, sour wheat finish. Incredible beer to say the least. Everything I love about sour beers is in this one. Loved it.  UPDATE.  This is consistently my go to for the style.  I rated this a long time ago, with way less beer miles on me, and I cant change my rating.  I love everything about this beer.  Quintessential sour.

Numerous bottles and a few times on draft as well. Fuck yes. This beer has everything I love. Lots of funk and lots of hop aroma and pure flavor. Begins with an amazing sour and saltiness, leading to copious amount of lemony and tropical fruity hops. Flavor follows suit..lots of fruity hops and funky sharp saltiness. Shit, Ive probably had this 10-15 times now and every time it nails it. Cant say that about too many beers...even some of the whitest whales. One of the best beers I have had all year and ever. Seriously. Cant believe there are so few rates on ratebeer.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2014 Hazy gold, bright lemon with puffy large white head, nice lacing with wispy island. High acid nose compared to the westbrook, mushroom salt funk with higher acidity, sharp with a little BO. High acid front palate, salty with huge grapefruit rind and tangerine mid before lightly doughy finish, moderate citric acids burn chest in hoppy, lightly skunky finish. Very refreshing if too hot, as much a sour as a gose.

Have had 3-4 glasses of this on tap recently. UN-BELIEVABLE. Bombers dont come close. Something unseen, a 3% lactic session sour, saddle and leather so faint, ungodly high-acid lime softness throughout the whole thing, ethereal salt slakes the palate near-finish like a down pillow to the face from the girl in only her panties that youll bang for the first time T-10.

Pour is hazed pale yellow with a good bit of white head and some larger bubbles. Nose is quite hoppy, lots of citrus and citra hops with a light tinge of salt and a dose of acidity. Taste is similar, tons of citra hop, a bit of acidity and moderate grain presence. Lots of citrusy flavors and just a hint of saltiness. Lighter carb with a juicy finish.

Draft at Ale Arsenal. Hazy golden color with a lasting white head. Big salty lemon herbal aroma. Flavor is a little bit ammonia-like but otherwise good. Salty with a bit of a Lysol/ammonia flavor - good in a way and a bit off-putting in another. Medium body with a bit of astringency. Pretty good but not too polished.
Tried this on tap. Hazy light yellow orange body. Aroma is sour and bready. The beer is pretty sour tasting, but is balanced well by a sharp bready taste. Sort of like sour dough.

This is a think of beauty. Pours hazy golden / orange with a small white head. The aroma has brett funk, barnyard, hints of pale malt, pineapple, mango and spice. It has a light crisp body with lots of fairly soft carbonation. The flavor begins with coriander, smooth malt, lots of juicy tropical fruits and some salt. The finish has boatloads of fruitiness, pepper, light funk and it is utterly refreshing. There is a lingering saltiness. Excellent.
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a hazy golden color with a bit of head. Very sour from start to finish. Some slight hop flavors emerging towards the end.

bottle. aroma of potent juicy kiwi fruit, lemon lime citrus zestiness. bit of musty fog character. bright apricot peachy fruit. moderate heavy bright kiwi lemon lime yogurt sourness. dry. would prefer toned done sourness, as a less sour version would lend to more chugeability. but aroma is quite fun. petes fine.

Bottle, shared by B3shine, thanks! Pours hazy gold, white head. Aroma of funk, dust, citrus, tropical fruit, bread. Taste is lightly salty, tart, funky, dust, tropical, citrus, wheat. Palate has average carbonation, slick, tart finish.

This beer pours a hazy pale yellow-gold color with a medium white head that dissipates steadily in an outer ring. Spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma of tart citrus, spices and wheat. Light-bodied with flavors of funky citrus, peppery yeast and hops. The finish is tart with a lingering tropical fruit and hops aftertaste. Good beer all around.

On tap at the Brick Store Pub 17th anniversary. Pours a hazy, light gold, with a big white, foamy head. The aroma is mango, grapefruit, grass, lemon juice, salt, and some light brett and lacto funk. Immediate, sharp sour flavor, with some light saltiness and a nice citrusy sweetness. While theres no perceptible hop bitterness, it seems like the hopping has balanced out the flavor quite well. Light to medium body, acidic and sharp, and a little mineraly. This is an amazingly well-made, balanced, and delicious beer. The extra hopping lights up the aroma wonderfully, and it seems to serve to balance out the harsh sourness, resulting is a sour, but balanced and very drinkable beer. I could drink a lot of this...

Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow, aroma is hoppy. Taste is quite unique. Its kind of a hybird of a ipa with a gose. Imagine a stillwater hoppy beer finishing with a westbrook gose. This one was a treat try.

Courtesy of mrebeks
Bottle: The aroma consists of lemon, pepper, minerals, sulfur, salt, and a touch of smoke. It pours a hazy/cloudy golden-orange with a small white head that quickly fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. The flavor starts with huge lemon tartness. The finish has sweet tarts and faint mineral salt. Its light-medium bodied with moderate-lively carbonation.

Hazy yellow in color... Aroma of passion fruits, barnyard funk... Flavor is amazing, really wheaty mouthfeel, but tropical fruits, citrus is extremely prevalent throughout, hints of funk on the finish... So refreshing, so puckering, really enjoyed this 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at ORiley & Conways, pours a cloudy gold with a thin white head, aroma is of big tropical fruit notes with a good amount of salt and funk, the flavor has a huge amount of lemon zest and funk at first with a sour and salty finish, seriously awesome, pulling up a chair as we speak and enjoying a few of these

22 ounce bottle from The Beer Trappe. Wow. That is some nose. Tropical fruit and something sour in aroma. Upfront salt, tropical fruit, slight brett like flavors. Citra really change the nature of the gose here. Excellent.

Another great bottle from Brother Lukaduke! Easily one of the best Goses Ive ever tasted. I like a truly salty Gose and this one delivers. But it goes even further, with brett and tropical hops adding complexity and punch. Well carbonated with a beautifully long finish. Layer after later of flavor. Gose hard!

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2014 22oz bottle in a tulip. Pours cloudy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of the base beer - a gose with the tartness, light wheat and malts, and the salt and coriander - plus an amazing citrusy hoppiness that adds to the beer. Flavor the same with such an awesome blend. Average to lighter texture. An amazing beer, with a nice improvement from the original beer with the hops blending well and adding to an already awesome Gose.  Edit: Pineapple and awesomeness. A great beer.

Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Fruit, tart, funk, citrus and malt aroma. Tart, funk, lemon, stonefruit, orange, hop, floral and malt flavors. Light body and a very tart mouthfeel. Citrus and tart finish. Reminds me of sour candy.

22oz bottle pours hazy pale straw yellow with 2 finger head. Nose is musty stonefruit, funky citrus, tart fruit juice, touch of cereal. Taste is super bright crisp acidic lacto lemon, orange, grapefruit, some subtle cereal malt and toasted white bread emerges as it warms. Finish is acidic sour lemon, lime, cereal, lacto, subtle saltiness. Nice!

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 On tap at good Dog with Eric and Craig. pours hazy golden orange. Aromas is heirloom Asian fruit most notably lychee and mangosteen. Flavor is peach skins, passionfruit, guava, tangerine, salt, pink lemonade and asian candies. Slightly rustic on finish hit mostly salivating pucker. Best draft beer of the week so far. Tried again at Cambridge...still amazing but $8 bucks for a 6oz pour of a 4.6% alcohol beer is bullshit.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2014 Pours a hazy yellow golden color with two fingers of sticky white foam. Nose is punchy with citrus, yuzu, grapefruit, lime, hints of barnyard brett fresh grass and fresh sea water. Palate follows nicely, bright citrus acidity, ruby grapefruit, lemon, lime, even some flint like stuff going on in here that adds a nice complexity. Cranked up is a great way to describe this,sour,  juicy puckering acidity, mellow salinity, round wheat... wow nice soft mouthfeel, great carbonation ! Tasty.
Draft. Golden hazy pour with white head. Brett, tart, salty, light citrus and funky aromas. Flavor is a cluster of salty gose, Brett, light citrus hop tones.
bottle enjoyed with Rudolf, Lackey & Bar Hop boys at Blue Monk, Buffalo. Lemon tartness, touch of salt, earthy bitterness, citrusy citra. Quite tart, full mouthfeel. Very Nice

Draft to goblet. Looks good; a hazy golden orange with white head. Smells hoppy and bretty. Tastes like it smells with some tart citrus notes as well as some salt. Pleasantly puckering on the palate. Good beer.

Holy barnyard batman. Tons of funk with some slight lemon undertones. Of course the normal salty component. The citrus is prominent and very refreshing. The tartness dries it out. Lots of passion in this one. The lemon and the sourness just continue to build into exceptional bliss. Awesome

Bottle from GBX. 
Aroma is yeasty, citrus. Lemon, orange. A little sourness. 
Truely a fascinating appearance. Almost like hazy lemonade... but its not a shandy! Nice lacing and head retention.
Taste is sour, sweet, salty. Yeasty. A hint of hops (not getting the "massive dose") Sour seems to overpower a bit, but combos well with the funkiness from the brett.

Palate is pretty aggressive on the sourness. Medium body. Pretty smooth.

A very complex, yet easy drinking ale. The gose series from Westbrook has been on point. Gozu, gose, and now this one. A really great beer. Wish I knew I could get it again.

On tap at Ridgewood (Raleigh)

Pours a murky yellow. Aroma is mild, with hints that this is a sour. Then you taste it. SOUR. TART. SOURLY TART. 

Had to wash the sourness out of my mouth with a rich stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2014 Bottle from CBX. Hazy deep straw color with a fluffy white head. Aroma of tons of citrus hoppiness, sweaty, cheesy Brett funk, subdued mineral salinity and wheat grains. Gripping, puckering, salivating sourness with lemon and grapefruit juice, lemon rind, cheesy Brett funk and light wheat grains. Smooth body with just the right amount of carbonation. Very solid, massive version of the Westbrook Gose.
